input_text:
Job Title: Technical Product Manager - Bioinformatics

Location: Santa Clara, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Administrative, Customer Service

Description:
Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people’s varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

A healthier future. It’s what drives us to innovate. To continuously advance science and ensure everyone has access to the healthcare they need today and for generations to come. Creating a world where we all have more time with the people we love.

The Opportunity

Key Responsibilities
You will identify and create new departmental procedures while following Roche Quality system proceduresYou will provide senior technical advisory support on complex process or product issues and offer technical guidance to cross-functional teamsYou will act as a resource for complex technical issues, leveraging organizational resources to achieve strategic on-market goalsYou will coordinate and facilitate training programs, understanding global customer needs and driving improvements to meet training requirementsYou will possess a broad understanding of products and systems, actively participating in pre-DI development activities and ensuring customer requirements are met before launch


Who You Are
Required Qualifications & Experience

You hold a Bachelor's degree in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, or an equivalent field, along with 8 years of relevant technical experienceYou have 2 years of experience demonstrating increasing leadership competenciesYou possess strong negotiation and influencing skills to effectively communicate objectives, deadlines, and expectations. Manages accountabilities to inspire and motivate others to perform at their bestYou demonstrate excellent communication, organizational, and logical thinking skills. Can easily communicate complex ideas and solutions to non-technical usersYou have advanced knowledge of genomics, including extensive experience with secondary/tertiary analysis of NGS data, interpretation of public annotation databases, and proficiency with tools such as BLAST, Bowtie, and ClustalYou are proficient in Bash, Python, and R, with a high degree of familiarity with Debian and RedHat-based distributions, particularly in system service and process configurationsYou have an understanding of networking fundamentals and services (IPv4, DNS, DHCP) is required, and project management experience in a scientific or academic setting is preferred. Knowledge of information security and data privacy fundamentals is also desired

Travel Requirements/Location Requirements

The employee will be located in Santa Clara, CA (with up to 2 days per week onsite)

 Travel time: 25% both domestic and international, required

The expected salary range for this position based on the primary location of Santa Clara, CA is $106,100 - 197,000. Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law. A discretionary annual bonus may be available based on individual and Company performance. This position also qualifies for the benefits detailed at the link provided below.

Benefits
Relocation benefits are not available for this job posting.

Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Roche is an equal opportunity employer and strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based upon an individual’s race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, mental/physical disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you have a disability and need an accommodation in relation to the online application process, please contact us by completing this form Accommodations for Applicants.

Roche is an equal opportunity employer and strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based upon an individual's race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, mental/physical disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
